posts.title: Rearrange panes
posts.contents: We’ve recently been mainly focused on fixing bugs, so everything should be feeling smoother and faster, especially on iOS and Android. We also have a fun new feature today: rearrangeable panes.

posts.title: Link multiple Gmail accounts
posts.contents:
If you have multiple Gmail accounts for personal and work emails you can now link them together in Moo.do. In the ‘Linked Accounts’ page of the Settings just enter the email address of the account you want to link.

Right now linked accounts only have access to Gmail. In the future we plan to expand this so you can access documents, and calendars across accounts.

This update also includes a lot of bug fixes, expecially for iOS and Android. If you see anything that looks broken or doesn’t work quite right, please send us an email at support@moo.do!

posts.title: Email Attachments
posts.contents:
Moo.do is now a fully functional email client! Today’s release brings many bugfixes along with two major email features. You can attach files to an email by dragging a file onto an email from a Google Drive pane or from your computer.

The new Snooze menu makes it easy to quickly select a time, or you can type any date you want.

In Development

  • Gmail
    • Unsubscribe button
    • Multiple accounts

posts.title: Agenda Drag Drop
posts.contents:
Droppable agenda is here! You can drag and drop items and emails onto the Agenda pane to schedule and prioritize them. We’re very excited about this feature as it makes it so much easier to manage appointments, and more importantly, it’s easy to drag emails right onto your calendar.

We would love to hear your feedback on the updates to the agenda and we’re excited to hear how you use email scheduling!

    • Unsubscribe button
    • Multiple accounts
    • Improved Snooze menu

posts.title: Advanced Display Settings
posts.contents:
Building on our earlier release of display settings, we’ve added a huge amount of customization options for our Premium users. You can now change font sizes, paddings, and colors of special text elements.

We have a lot more new features coming in the next few weeks, so keep an eye on our blog or follow us on Twitter @MooDoApp for updates.
